trans-unit.source: Serves as the base class for designers that provide design-time support in the Visual Web Designer for controls that are derived from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl"></xref> abstract class.

In the Visual Web Designer, when the user switches from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes a control derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> class is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface.
When the user switches back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class serves as the base class for designers that provide design-time support in the Visual Web Designer for controls that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class properties provide the following functionality:

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property returns a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object, which typically contains an object that is derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> object for each level in the inheritance tree of the designer.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.DataTextField%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.DataValueField%2A> properties provide access to the corresponding properties of a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> class.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.DataTextField%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.DataValueField%2A> indicate the fields of the data source that provide the text and value content of the list items, respectively.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class methods provide the following functionality:

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.DataBind%2A> method binds the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> to a design-time data source.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method returns the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetSelectedDataSource%2A> method returns the design-time <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> component from the associated control container.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetResolvedSelectedDataSource%2A> method returns the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> from the control container, resolved to the design-time <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataBoundControlDesigner.DataMember%2A> property of the control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view and design the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl>.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> method is called when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> for the associated control has changed.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method is used to remove additional properties from, add additional properties to, or shadow properties of the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner"></xref> class.

The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class when it creates the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> class on the design surface.
Gets the designer action list collection for the designer.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> associated with the designer.
Binds the specified control to the design-time data source.

For the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataBoundControlDesigner> base class, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataBoundControlDesigner.DataBind%2A> method sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSourceID%2A> properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> object to reference the design-time data source, then calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataBind%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method, and then restores the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSourceID%2A> properties to their original values.

For the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class, however, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.DataBind%2A> method has no functionality, because <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> objects were just added to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection.
The associated control derived from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl"></xref>, or a copy of that control.
Gets or sets the data text field of the control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.DataTextField%2A> property sets or retrieves the markup to use for the design-time representation of the control at run time.

This provides access via the designer to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.DataTextField%2A> property of the associated control, which corresponds to the field of the data source that provides the text content of the list items.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.DataTextField"></xref> of the list control.
Gets or sets the data value field of the control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.DataValueField%2A> property provides access via the designer to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.DataValueField%2A> property of the associated control, which indicates the field of the data source that provides the value content of the list items.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.DataValueField"></xref> of the list control.
Gets the HTML that is used to represent the control at design time.

If the associated control derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> object is data-bound, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method clears the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection and adds a <xref:System.String> message indicating the control is data-bound.

If the associated control is not data-bound and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection is empty, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> adds a <xref:System.String> message indicating the control is unbound.
Then, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> calls its base method to generate the markup.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the markup used to render the control derived from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl"></xref> at design time.
Gets the data source component from the associated control container, resolved to a specific data member.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetSelectedDataSource%2A> method returns `null` if a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> property is not found, or if a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> with the same name does not exist.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> cannot be resolved to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataBoundControlDesigner.DataMember%2A> property of the associated control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetResolvedSelectedDataSource%2A> returns an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface containing the design-time <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A>.

An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable"></xref> containing the design-time <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource"></xref>, resolved to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataBoundControlDesigner.DataMember"></xref> of the associated control.
Gets the data source component from the associated control container.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetSelectedDataSource%2A> method returns `null` if a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> property is not found, or if a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> with the same name does not exist.

An object implementing an <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable"></xref> interface and containing the design-time <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource"></xref> of the associated control.
Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.

The designer host calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.Initialize%2A> method when it is ready to use the designer to render the control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> class.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.Initialize%2A> method and its base methods configure properties and connect to events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.
The `component` parameter is the control, derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl>, that is associated with this designer or is a copy of that control.
A control derived from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl"></xref> that implements an <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref>.
Called when the data source for the associated control has changed.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> base method connects the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> object to the current data source and, if that is different from the data source to which the control was connected, updates the design-time markup.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> method updates the design-time markup after connecting to the current data source.
Called when the data source for the associated control has changed.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> base method connects the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> class to the current data source and, if that is different from the data source to which the control was connected, updates the design-time markup.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> method of the designer unconditionally updates the design-time markup after connecting to the current data source.
The value of `forceUpdateView` is ignored.
A <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> that indicates whether the design-time markup is to be unconditionally updated.
This parameter is ignored.
Used by the designer to remove additional properties from or add properties to the display in the **Properties** grid or to shadow properties of the associated control.

Control designers use methods that are derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to shadow various control properties with corresponding design-time properties that the designer implements, and to add properties to or remove properties from the **Properties** grid.

For controls that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> object, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> adds the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataFieldConverter> attribute to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.DataTextField%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.DataValueField%2A> properties of the associated control.
A collection implementing the <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> of the added or shadowed properties to expose for the associated control at design time.
Gets a value that indicates whether the associated control should render its default action lists.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.UseDataSourcePickerActionList%2A> property returns `false` so that a data source dropdown is not displayed with the **Choose Data Source** menu item in the **Common Tasks** context menu.

Instead, this menu item displays the **Choose Data Source** dialog box, which allows the user to select a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.DataTextField%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.DataValueField%2A> properties.
Always returns `false`.
